intro: Urostigma subnymphaeifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed urostigma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant has a woody stem and is often found in humid forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
